page.title: 19MINING AND MINERALS
page.content: The area contains many disused jet mines. In the village of Great Broughton, some two miles to the North is a pub called The Jet Miners to which the buyers would come from Whitby. Intensive mining for coal, jet and alum occurred during the nineteenth century along the 900 ft contour leaving piles of shale which remain barren still. The field system in square 4 is reputed to be where the miners used to keep their horses. Jet occurs in irregular lumps and pockets and was often found - if it was to be found at all - at the bottom of alum mines. There were several alum works nearby. Fossils are to be found in the disused quarries, and on the North face of Cringle Moor inscriptions and a face are carved. At least one farm has provided bed and breakfast to people come in search of fossils.
